001package ca.gc.cra.radar.infrastructure.protocol.http;
002
003import ca.gc.cra.radar.application.port.PairingEngine;
004import ca.gc.cra.radar.application.util.MessagePairer;
005import ca.gc.cra.radar.domain.msg.MessageEvent;
006import ca.gc.cra.radar.domain.msg.MessagePair;
007import ca.gc.cra.radar.domain.msg.MessageType;
008import java.util.Objects;
009import java.util.Optional;
010
011/**
012 * Simple FIFO pairer assuming client -> request and server -> response semantics.
013 * <p>Not thread-safe; maintain a dedicated instance per flow.</p>
014 *
015 * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
016 */
017public final class HttpPairingEngineAdapter implements PairingEngine, AutoCloseable {
018  private final MessagePairer delegate = new MessagePairer();
019
020  /**
021   * Creates an HTTP pairing engine adapter with FIFO semantics.
022   *
023   * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
024   */
025  public HttpPairingEngineAdapter() {}
026
027  /**
028   * Pairs HTTP message events into request/response tuples.
029   *
030   * @param event message event to pair
031   * @return completed pair when available; otherwise empty
032   * @throws NullPointerException if {@code event} is {@code null}
033   * @throws Exception if pairing fails
034   * @implNote Uses {@link MessagePairer} FIFO buffering; responses without prior requests generate best-effort pairs.
035   * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
036   */  @Override
037  public Optional<MessagePair> accept(MessageEvent event) throws Exception {
038    Objects.requireNonNull(event, "event");
039    boolean isRequest = event.type() == MessageType.REQUEST;
040    return delegate.accept(event, isRequest);
041  }
042
043  /**
044   * Releases pairing resources by clearing queued events.
045   *
046   * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
047   */  @Override
048  public void close() {
049    delegate.close();
050  }
051}
052
053
054
